mdRecord.dcterms:title: Congregation Beth Israel, interior
Charlottesville Synagogue
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Spooner, George Wallace (American architect, 1820-1904) [work]
Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Detail of stained glass window with wildlife motif

First built at the corner of Market Street and Second Street NE in Charlottesville. Moved in 1904 to build federal court and post office. It was dismantled and reassembled, reusing some of the original fabric on its present site on the Northeast corner of Third and East Jefferson Streets. (from: K. Edward Lay, The Architecture of Jefferson Country) [work]
